title: Increasing and decreasing behavior with parameter

content.question: Let f be the function given byÂ <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <mi>k</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4042@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where k is a constant. For what values of k, if any, is f strictly decreasing on the interval (-1, 1)?

choices.label: There are no such values of k.

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
